str2: A particle of succession, then, moreover.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
Thomas, also called Didymus, one of the Twelve. Of Chaldee origin; the twin; Thomas, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A finger. Probably from deka; a finger.
From an adverb form of hode; in this same spot, i.e. Here or hither.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: See! Lo! Behold! Look! Second person singular imperative middle voice of eido; used as imperative lo!

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A hand.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To carry, bear, bring; I conduct, lead; perhaps: I make publicly known. A primary verb.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A hand.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
The side of the body. Of uncertain affinity; a rib, i.e. side.
(passively) untrustworthy (person), or incredible (thing).
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
